conclusion: The problem involves a square conductor frame with side length l moving uniformly through a magnetic field with width d at speed v.
The frame moves from the left side of the magnetic field to the right side.

premise: The frame moves uniformly with speed v.
conclusion: The time taken for the frame to enter the magnetic field is the length of the frame divided by the speed, which is l/v.

premise: The frame moves uniformly with speed v.
conclusion: The time taken for the frame to exit the magnetic field is also l/v.

premise: The time to enter the magnetic field is l/v and the time to exit is l/v.
conclusion: The total time during which there is an induced current in the frame is the sum of these two times, which is 2l/v.
